    Setting up Gateway and Sensors

    About Gateway

    A Gateway is a hardware device that acts as a "Gate" between two networks. It may be a router, firewall, server, or other devices that enable traffic to flow in and out of the network. While a gateway protects the nodes within the network, it also a node itself. The gateway node is considered to be on the "edge" of the network as all data must flow through it before coming in or going out of the network. It may also translate data received from outside networks into a format or protocol recognized by devices within the internal network. The Gateways that are created under Gateway Model of the Configurations will be available under Gateway Models of the Channel Configuration. The Gateways can be created using the existing Gateway Model by selecting any one of the models from the list.

    Function of Gateways:

    Gateway's basic function is to simplify the connection between two different devices or systems. It is a device capable of linking two networks that use different base protocols.

    Note: To understand the different types of protocols , please refer to Protocols section

    Adding New Gateway

    To configure the Gateway in software

    • Click Data Acquisition -> Gateways

    • Click on + icon on the gateway page

      • On the pop-box you will see three Tabs All, Protocol, and, Library.
      • In All Tab you will see the entire list of Protocol and Library
      • Library is the collections of gateway , when you creat a Gateway Elnet7 gives you a feature to add that gateway to library so that you can use it later
      • Protocol is what you will be clicking on to configure the Gateway

    • Select The protocol you want to configure for the gateway , by selecting Protocol it will display its respective forms.

    • Once you click Create Gateway the gateway will be created and its visible on the Monitor Gateway & Sensor and you can also view it under the Gateways

    • The Green colour apprearing on the gateway card show's that the gateway is configured correctly and its communicating

    • The Red colour apprearing on the gateway may be due to its wrong configuration and gateway is not communicating.\\

    Adding Devices (Sensors)

    After creating the Gateway, the Devices (Sensors) should be added. The (Sensors) can be added by two methods. One is using Customised Devices and the other is using the existing Device Models.

    • To add the sensors click on Sensors under Data Acquisition

    • Click on + sign to add the Sensor to the Gateway that is created.

    • Select the Gateway from list to add the device and click Continue

    • Select the sensor series from the Library or, to create the new sensor Select Create Custom Sensor

    • Once clicked on Create Custom Sensor a new window for configutaion will open which has two section in the form General Info and Configuration

    • In General Info,

    • Device model name,

    • Type i.e., what Type of meter example Energy meter,

    • Make of the sensor i.e., Elmeasure,

    • Assign toi.e., the site where the device is configured,

    • Belongs TO i.e. were it belongs like DG Supply, Main Supply etc .. * Device COM ID,

    • Time out in seconds,

    • Device Selection,

    • Status Timeout.

    • Under Configuration you can add block with setting show in below picture and assign the Tags .

    Gateway Library

    Gateway Library gives you ability to create your own custom library

    • To create Library for Gateway click on Gateway Library under Data Acquisition Select the protocol

    • Enter all the information base on protocol selected and click Create Gateway Model

    Sensor Library

    To create Library for Sensors click on Sensor Library under Data Acquisition enter all required deatils as per the Model selection

    • Step 1 : Enter the General Information Pertaining to Sensor

    • Step 2 : Enter the Block and Tag details and click Save Device Model

    Last updated on 12/4/2020 by MithuLohar
